list_definition.definition: a movable seat for one person, with a back to it
the position of a person who is chairman at a meeting etc
the office of a university professor

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He holds the chair of History at this university.

list_definition.definition: to be chairman at (a meeting etc)

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He chaired the meeting last night.

list_ex_of_english: Many innocent souls believe a chair is a thing you sit on.
Metasemantically, "law" behaves much like simple artifact terms such as "chair" and "hammer," which are not linguistically deferential.
While members of their communities fought, argued and even died for their beliefs the town council added arms to the mayoral chair.
When shown a chair apparently moving itself (pulled by transparent plastic wire) babies showed surprise and sometimes fear.
What "three" is three chairs do not tell us, nor three apples, three cats nor any three things.
Infants were seated in a high chair across from a black curtain behind which a video camera for recording infant behavior was located.
Breathing heavily, she sat back in the chair and closed her eyes.
Then the chair leg is no longer visible.
